definition: to whine on for days (idiom)/to endlessly grumble complaints/incessant whining
variant of 叫[jiao4]
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
surname Lian
day/sky/heaven

sentences.english: Again has a look us, usually meets slightly is difficult, we all complain incessantly.
sentences.chinese: 再看看我们，平时遇到一点小困难，我们都叫苦连天。

sentences.english: The road works caused much complaint among local neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 修路工程使当地居民叫苦连天。

sentences.english: The road-works caused much complaint among local neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 修路工程使当地居民叫苦连天。

definition: to complain without stopping (idiom); to bitch endlessly/incessant grievances
to suffer unspeakable misery/indescribably painful/hellish
lit. cries of complaint fill the roads (idiom); complaints rise all around/discontent is openly voiced
to whine about hardships/to complain of one's bitter lot/to complain/to grumble
wail/lament/voice of complaint
to tremble with fear (idiom)/scared witless
to have difficulty getting by/to struggle (financially etc)
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
panic-stricken
lit. badly burned about the head (from trying to put out a fire) (idiom)/fig. hard-pressed/under pressure (from a heavy workload, creditors etc)
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
angry, but not daring to speak out (idiom); obliged to remain silent about one's resentment/unable to voice objections
pinyin: gan3 nu4 er2 bu4 gan3 yan2

definition: sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
to be in straitened circumstances
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
